suncertify.db.data
Class URLyBirdPropertyFileManager

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.data.URLyBirdPropertyFileManager

public class URLyBirdPropertyFileManager
extends java.lang.Object

This Object is preserved to manage the writing and reading of the application property file/configuration file as required in respect of the mode the application is running on

Author:
Segun

public URLyBirdPropertyFileManager()
Method Detail

writeServerProperties

public static void writeServerProperties(java.lang.String dbPath,
                                         long port)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
This function accepts 2 arguments that will be written respectively into the required "suncertify.properties" which is located in the current working directory. The argument String value and long value are written into the file using DataOutputStream Its designed for writing property file of the application when running on Server mode

Parameters:
dbPath - - The String value of the database path
port - - long value of the port number which the server resides
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - if an error occur when writing to the designated stream
See Also:
DataOutputStream

writeClientProperties

public static void writeClientProperties(java.lang.String hostName,
                                         long port)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
This function accepts 2 arguments that will be written respectively into the required "suncertify.properties" which is located in the current working directory. The argument String value and long value are written into the file using DataOutputStream Its designed for writing property file of the application when running on Server mode

Parameters:
hostName - - The String value of the server host Address or IP
port - - long value of the port number which the server resides
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - if an error occur when writing to the designated stream
See Also:
DataOutputStream

writeAloneProperties

public static void writeAloneProperties(java.lang.String dbPath)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
This function accepts 1 arguments that will be written into the required "suncertify.properties" which is located in the current working directory. The argument String value is written into the file using DataOutputStream Its designed for writing property file of the application when running on Alone mode

Parameters:
dbPath - - The String value of the database path
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - if an error occur when writing to the designated stream
See Also:

readAloneProperties

public static java.lang.String readAloneProperties()
                                            throws java.io.IOException
This function reads the alone configured property file from the required "suncertify.properties" file as

Returns:
- a string value of the database location/path
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - if any Input and Output Error occur at reading file

readClientProperties

public static java.lang.String[] readClientProperties()
                                               throws java.io.IOException
This function reads the client configured property file from the required "suncertify.properties" file as

Returns:
- an array of String value of the host name or IP address at index 0 and the port number on index 1
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - if any Input and Output Error occur at reading file

readServerProperties

public static java.lang.String[] readServerProperties()
                                               throws java.io.IOException
This function reads the server configured property file from the required "suncertify.properties" file as required by the specification

Returns:
an array of String size 2 which the first element represents the database location and the second element represent the port number off the server which can be connected to remotely
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - if any Input and Output Error occur at reading file

isPropertiesFileExist

public static boolean isPropertiesFileExist()
This function check if this application property file exist or not

Returns:
true if The application was previously executed and had a property file created in working directory or false if not
